section_list.name: MBMS SESSION START REQUEST
aoa:
This message is sent by the MME to establish an MBMS E-RAB and an M3AP signalling connection.
Direction: MME ? MCE.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.3.2 MME MBMS M3AP ID - Section Description: The MME MBMS M3AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M3 interface within the MME.
9.2.3.3 TMGI - Section Description: The TMGI uniquely identifies the MBMS Bearer Service.

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.3.4 MBMS Session Identity - Section Description: The MBMS Session Identity identifies the session of a MBMS Bearer Service in E-UTRAN and is used by the UE to recognise repetitions of a session. This IE is transparent to RAN. 9.2.3.4 MBMS Session Identity IE Semantics: Coded same way as the MBMS Session Identity IE as defined in TS 29.061 [8].

9.2.1.3 MBMS E-RAB QoS parameters - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS to be applied to an MBMS E-RAB. 8.2 MBMS Session Start 8.2.2 Successful Operation In MBSFN operation - The MCE shall use the information in the MBMS E-RAB QoS parameters IE to determine whether the requested configuration can be accommodated within E-UTRAN. - If the Time of MBMS Data Transfer IE is included in the MBMS SESSION START REQUEST message, the MCE shall, if supported, take it into account for the synchronization of the corresponding MCCH Update instead of the Minimum Time to MBMS Data Transfer IE. The MCE shall ensure the eNB applies the MCCH update from the last modification period before the time indicated by the Time of MBMS Data Transfer IE.
9.2.1.3 QCI IE Semantics: QoS Class Identifier defined in TS 23.246 [6]. Coding is specified in TS 23.203 [7].

9.2.1.3 GBR QoS Information IE Semantics: This IE applies to GBR bearers only and shall be ignored otherwise. 9.2.1.5 GBR QoS Information - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum and guaranteed bit rates of a GBR bearer for downlink.

9.2.1.5 MBMS E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the maximum downlink MBMS E-RAB Bit Rate (i.e. from the EPC to E-UTRAN) for this bearer. 9.2.1.6 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.1.6 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.1.5 MBMS E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the downlink guaranteed MBMS E-RAB Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) from the EPC to the E-UTRAN for this bearer. 9.2.1.6 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.1.6 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.1.8 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance of an MBMS E-RAB compared to other MBMS E-RABs for allocation and retention of the MBMS E-RAB.

9.2.1.8 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE should be understood as the “priority of allocation and retention” (see TS 23.246 [6]). Usage: Value 15 means “no priority”. Values between 1 and 14 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. 1 is the highest and 14 the lowest. Value 0 shall be treated as a logical error if received.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption)
9.2.1.8 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other MBMS E-RABs
9.2.1.8 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the MBMS E-RAB to preemption of other MBMS E-RABs.

9.2.3.5 MBMS Session Duration - Section Description: This IE defines the duration of the MBMS Session. 9.2.3.5 MBMS Session Duration IE Semantics: Coded as the value part of MBMS-Session-Duration AVP as defined in TS 29.061 [8].

9.2.3.6 MBMS Service Area - Section Description: The MBMS Service Area IE consists of a list of one or several MBMS Service Area Identities where each MBMS Service Area Identity is frequency agnostic and can be mapped onto one or more cells. 9.2.3.6 MBMS Service Area IE Semantics: Value part coded per MBMS Service Area AVP as defined in TS 29.061 [8].

9.2.3.8 Minimum Time to MBMS Data Transfer - Section Description: This IE denotes the minimum time occurring between the transmission of the MBMS SESSION START REQUEST message to the MCE and the actual start of the data transfer. The coding of this element is described in TS 48.018 [10]. 9.2.3.8 Minimum Time to MBMS Data Transfer IE Semantics: Coded as the value part of Time to MBMS Data Transfer IE defined in TS 48.018 [10]. 8.2 MBMS Session Start 8.2.2 Successful Operation In MBSFN operation - The MCE shall use the information in the MBMS E-RAB QoS parameters IE to determine whether the requested configuration can be accommodated within E-UTRAN. - If the Time of MBMS Data Transfer IE is included in the MBMS SESSION START REQUEST message, the MCE shall, if supported, take it into account for the synchronization of the corresponding MCCH Update instead of the Minimum Time to MBMS Data Transfer IE. The MCE shall ensure the eNB applies the MCCH update from the last modification period before the time indicated by the Time of MBMS Data Transfer IE.

8.2 MBMS Session Start 8.2.2 Successful Operation If the MCE receives the MBMS SESSION START REQUEST message including the Alternative TNL Information IE, it may send the content of that IE to the eNB.

9.2.2.1 IP Address - Section Description: This information element is an IP address to be used for the user plane transport. 9.2.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Radio Network Layer is not supposed to interpret the address information. It should pass it to the transport layer for interpretation. For details on the Transport Layer Address, see ref. TS 36.445 [9].

9.2.2.1 IP Address - Section Description: This information element is an IP address to be used for the user plane transport. 9.2.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Radio Network Layer is not supposed to interpret the address information. It should pass it to the transport layer for interpretation. For details on the Transport Layer Address, see ref. TS 36.445 [9].

9.2.3.9 Absolute Time of MBMS Data - Section Description: This IE denotes the absolute time of the actual start or stop of the MBMS data transfer. 9.2.3.9 Absolute Time of MBMS Data IE Semantics: Time in seconds relative to 00:00:00 on 1 January 1900 (calculated as continuous time without leap seconds and traceable to a common time reference) where binary encoding of the integer part is in the first 32 bits and binary encoding of the fraction part in the last 32 bits. The fraction part is expressed with a granularity of 1 /2**32 second. 8.2 MBMS Session Start 8.2.2 Successful Operation In MBSFN operation - The MCE shall use the information in the MBMS E-RAB QoS parameters IE to determine whether the requested configuration can be accommodated within E-UTRAN. - If the Time of MBMS Data Transfer IE is included in the MBMS SESSION START REQUEST message, the MCE shall, if supported, take it into account for the synchronization of the corresponding MCCH Update instead of the Minimum Time to MBMS Data Transfer IE. The MCE shall ensure the eNB applies the MCCH update from the last modification period before the time indicated by the Time of MBMS Data Transfer IE.

9.2.3.10 Re-establishment - Section Description: This IE allows identification of the serving MME during some restoration scenarios. Restoration functions are specified in TS 23.007 [14]. 8.2 MBMS Session Start 8.2.2 Successful Operation If the MCE receives the MBMS SESSION START REQUEST message including the Re-establishment IE for a service which is already ongoing, it shall, if supported, accept this message and replace the MBMS context for that service (see TS 23.007 [14]).

8.2 MBMS Session Start 8.2.2 Successful Operation If the MCE receives the MBMS SESSION START REQUEST message including the Alternative TNL Information IE, it may send the content of that IE to the eNB.

9.2.2.1 IP Address - Section Description: This information element is an IP address to be used for the user plane transport. 9.2.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Radio Network Layer is not supposed to interpret the address information. It should pass it to the transport layer for interpretation. For details on the Transport Layer Address, see ref. TS 36.445 [9].

9.2.2.1 IP Address - Section Description: This information element is an IP address to be used for the user plane transport. 9.2.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Radio Network Layer is not supposed to interpret the address information. It should pass it to the transport layer for interpretation. For details on the Transport Layer Address, see ref. TS 36.445 [9].
9.1.3 GTP DL TEID IE Semantics: Shall be set to same value as the GTP DL TEID IE of the TNL Information IE.

9.2.1.11 MBMS Cell List - Section Description: This IE consists of a list of cell identities. 8.2 MBMS Session Start 8.2.2 Successful Operation If the MCE receives the MBMS SESSION START REQUEST message including the MBMS Cell List IE, the MCE may use it as defined in TS 36.300 [3]. 8.2 MBMS Session Start 8.2.3 Unsuccessful Operation If the MCE receives MBMS SESSION START REQUEST message including the MBMS Cell List IE and the list includes no cell controlled by eNB with which the MCE has connection, the MME shall be informed by the MBMS SESSION START FAILURE message including a suitable cause value, e.g. "Un-involved MCE".
9.2.1.11 Cell ID IE Semantics: Global ID of the cell. 9.2.1.12 E-UTRAN CGI - Section Description: This information element is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.1.12 Cell Identity IE Semantics: The 18, 20 or 21 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity correspond to the eNB ID (Global eNB ID IE defined in TS 36.413 [11]).

section_list.name: MBMS SESSION START RESPONSE
aoa:
This message is sent by the MCE to report the successful outcome of the request from the MBMS SESSION START message.
Direction: MCE ? MME.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.3.2 MME MBMS M3AP ID - Section Description: The MME MBMS M3AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M3 interface within the MME.
9.2.3.1 MCE MBMS M3AP ID - Section Description: The MCE MBMS M3AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M3 interface within the MCE.

9.2.1.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the MME or the MCE when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing. For further details on how to use the Criticality Diagnostics IE, (see section 10).

9.2.1.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.1.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.1.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.1.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value 'ignore' shall not be used.
9.2.1.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

section_list.name: MBMS SESSION START FAILURE
aoa:
This message is sent by the MCE to report the unsuccessful outcome of the request from the MBMS SESSION START message.
Direction: MCE ? MME.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.3.2 MME MBMS M3AP ID - Section Description: The MME MBMS M3AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M3 interface within the MME.
9.2.1.2 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the M3AP protocol.

ENUMERATED (Unknown or already allocated MCE MBMS M3AP ID, Unknown or already allocated MME MBMS M3AP ID, Unknown or inconsistent pair of MBMS M3AP IDs, Radio resources not available, Invalid QoS combination, Interaction with other procedure, Not supported QCI value, Unspecified, …, Un-involved MCE)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, ...)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Unspecified, ...)

9.2.1.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the MME or the MCE when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing. For further details on how to use the Criticality Diagnostics IE, (see section 10).

9.2.1.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.1.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.1.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.1.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value 'ignore' shall not be used.
9.2.1.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

section_list.name: MBMS SESSION STOP REQUEST
aoa:
This message is sent by the MME to release the corresponding MBMS E-RAB and the MBMS service associated logical M3 connection.
Direction: MME ? MCE.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.3.2 MME MBMS M3AP ID - Section Description: The MME MBMS M3AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M3 interface within the MME.
9.2.3.1 MCE MBMS M3AP ID - Section Description: The MCE MBMS M3AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M3 interface within the MCE.

9.2.3.9 Absolute Time of MBMS Data - Section Description: This IE denotes the absolute time of the actual start or stop of the MBMS data transfer. 9.2.3.9 Absolute Time of MBMS Data IE Semantics: Time in seconds relative to 00:00:00 on 1 January 1900 (calculated as continuous time without leap seconds and traceable to a common time reference) where binary encoding of the integer part is in the first 32 bits and binary encoding of the fraction part in the last 32 bits. The fraction part is expressed with a granularity of 1 /2**32 second. 8.3 MBMS Session Stop 8.3.2 Successful Operation If the Time of MBMS Data Stop IE is included in the MBMS SESSION STOP REQUEST message, the MCE shall, if supported, take it into account for the synchronization of the corresponding MCCH Update. The MCE shall ensure the eNB applies the MCCH update from the first modification period after the time indicated by the Time of MBMS Data Stop IE.

section_list.name: MBMS SESSION STOP RESPONSE
aoa:
This message is sent by the MCE to acknowledge the MBMS SESSION STOP message.
Direction: MCE ? MME.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.3.2 MME MBMS M3AP ID - Section Description: The MME MBMS M3AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M3 interface within the MME.
9.2.3.1 MCE MBMS M3AP ID - Section Description: The MCE MBMS M3AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M3 interface within the MCE.

9.2.1.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the MME or the MCE when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing. For further details on how to use the Criticality Diagnostics IE, (see section 10).

9.2.1.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.1.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.1.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.1.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value 'ignore' shall not be used.
9.2.1.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

section_list.name: ERROR INDICATION
aoa:
This message is sent by both the MME and the MCE and is used to indicate that some error has been detected in the node
Direction: MCE ? MME and MME ? MCE.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.3.2 MME MBMS M3AP ID - Section Description: The MME MBMS M3AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M3 interface within the MME.

9.2.3.1 MCE MBMS M3AP ID - Section Description: The MCE MBMS M3AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M3 interface within the MCE. 8.4 Error Indication 8.4.2 Successful Operation In case the Error Indication procedure is triggered by utilising MBMS-service-associated signalling the MCE MBMS M3AP ID IE and the MME MBMS M3AP IE shall be included in the ERROR INDICATION message. If one or both of MCE MBMS M3AP ID IE and the MME MBMS M3AP IE are not correct, the cause shall be set to appropriate value e.g. "Unknown or already allocated MCE MBMS M3AP ID", "Unknown or already allocated MME MBMS M3AP ID" or "Unknown or inconsistent pair of MBMS M3AP ID".

9.2.1.2 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the M3AP protocol. 8.4 Error Indication 8.4.2 Successful Operation The ERROR INDICATION message shall contain at least either the Cause IE or the Criticality Diagnostics IE.

ENUMERATED (Unknown or already allocated MCE MBMS M3AP ID, Unknown or already allocated MME MBMS M3AP ID, Unknown or inconsistent pair of MBMS M3AP IDs, Radio resources not available, Invalid QoS combination, Interaction with other procedure, Not supported QCI value, Unspecified, …, Un-involved MCE)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, ...)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Unspecified, ...)

9.2.1.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the MME or the MCE when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing. For further details on how to use the Criticality Diagnostics IE, (see section 10). 8.4 Error Indication 8.4.2 Successful Operation The ERROR INDICATION message shall contain at least either the Cause IE or the Criticality Diagnostics IE.

9.2.1.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.1.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.1.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.1.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value 'ignore' shall not be used.
9.2.1.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

section_list.name: RESET
aoa:
This message is sent by both the MME and the MCE and is used to request that the M3 interface, or parts of the M3 interface, to be reset.
Direction: MME ? MCE and MCE ? MME
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.1.2 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the M3AP protocol.

ENUMERATED (Unknown or already allocated MCE MBMS M3AP ID, Unknown or already allocated MME MBMS M3AP ID, Unknown or inconsistent pair of MBMS M3AP IDs, Radio resources not available, Invalid QoS combination, Interaction with other procedure, Not supported QCI value, Unspecified, …, Un-involved MCE)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, ...)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Unspecified, ...)

8.5.2 Successful Operation 8.5.2.1 Reset Procedure Initiated from the MME If the RESET message contains the MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection list IE, then: - The MCE shall use the MME MBMS M3AP ID IE and/or the MCE MBMS M3AP ID IE to explicitly identify the MBMS service association(s) to be reset. - The MCE shall in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message include, for each MBMS service association to be reset, the MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IE in the MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection list IE. The MBMS-Service -associated logical M3-connection Item IEs shall be in the same order as received in the RESET message and shall include also unknown MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connections. Empty MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IEs, received in the RESET message, may be omitted in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. - If the MME MBMS M3AP ID IE is included in the MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IE for an MBMS service association, the MCE shall include the MME MBMS M3AP ID IE in the corresponding MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IE in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. - If the MCE MBMS M3AP ID IE is included in an MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IE for an MBMS service association, the MCE shall include the MCE MBMS M3AP ID IE in the corresponding MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IE in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. 8.5.2 Successful Operation 8.5.2.2 Reset Procedure Initiated from the E-UTRAN If the RESET message contains the MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection list IE, then: - The MME shall use the MME MBMS M3AP ID IE and/or the MCE MBMS M3AP ID IE to explicitly identify the MBMS service association(s) to be reset. - The MME shall in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message include, for each MBMS service association to be reset, the MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IE in the MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection list IE. The MBMS-Service -associated logical M3-connection Item IEs shall be in the same order as received in the RESET message and shall include also unknown MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connections. Empty MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IEs, received in the RESET message, may be omitted in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. - If the MME MBMS M3AP ID IE is included in the MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IE for an MBMS service association, the MME shall include the MME MBMS M3AP ID IE in the corresponding MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IE in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. - If the MCE MBMS M3AP ID IE is included in an MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IE for an MBMS service association, the MME shall include the MCE MBMS M3AP ID IE in the corresponding MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IE in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. 8.5.3 Abnormal Conditions 8.5.3.1 Abnormal Condition at the EPC If the RESET message includes the MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection list IE, but neither the MME MBMS M3AP ID IE nor the MCE MBMS M3AP ID IE is present for an MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IE, then the MME shall ignore the MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IE. The MME may return the empty MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IE in the MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection list IE in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. 8.5.3 Abnormal Conditions 8.5.3.2 Abnormal Condition at the E-UTRAN If the RESET message includes the MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection list IE, but neither the MME MBMS M3AP ID IE nor the MCE MBMS M3AP ID IE is present for an MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IE, then the MCE shall ignore the MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IE. The MCE may return the empty MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IE in the MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection list IE in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message.

8.5.2 Successful Operation 8.5.2.1 Reset Procedure Initiated from the MME If the RESET message contains the MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection list IE, then: - The MCE shall use the MME MBMS M3AP ID IE and/or the MCE MBMS M3AP ID IE to explicitly identify the MBMS service association(s) to be reset. - The MCE shall in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message include, for each MBMS service association to be reset, the MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IE in the MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection list IE. The MBMS-Service -associated logical M3-connection Item IEs shall be in the same order as received in the RESET message and shall include also unknown MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connections. Empty MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IEs, received in the RESET message, may be omitted in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. - If the MME MBMS M3AP ID IE is included in the MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IE for an MBMS service association, the MCE shall include the MME MBMS M3AP ID IE in the corresponding MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IE in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. - If the MCE MBMS M3AP ID IE is included in an MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IE for an MBMS service association, the MCE shall include the MCE MBMS M3AP ID IE in the corresponding MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IE in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message. 8.5.2 Successful Operation 8.5.2.2 Reset Procedure Initiated from the E-UTRAN If the RESET message contains the MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection list IE, then: - The MME shall use the MME MBMS M3AP ID IE and/or the MCE MBMS M3AP ID IE to explicitly identify the MBMS service association(s) to be reset. - The MME shall in the RESET ACKNOWLEDGE message include, for each MBMS service association to be reset, the MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection Item IE in the MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connection list IE. The MBMS-Service -associated logical M3-connection Item IEs shall be in the same order as received in the RESET message and shall include also unknown MBMS-Service-associated logical M3-connections. 9.2.1.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the MME or the MCE when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing. For further details on how to use the Criticality Diagnostics IE, (see section 10).

9.2.1.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.1.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.1.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.1.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value 'ignore' shall not be used.
9.2.1.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

section_list.name: MBMS SESSION UPDATE REQUEST
aoa:
This message is sent by the MME to inform the MCE of the changed characteristics of an ongoing MBMS service session.
Direction: MME ? MCE.
9.2.1.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.3.2 MME MBMS M3AP ID - Section Description: The MME MBMS M3AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M3 interface within the MME.
9.2.3.1 MCE MBMS M3AP ID - Section Description: The MCE MBMS M3AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M3 interface within the MCE.
9.2.3.3 TMGI - Section Description: The TMGI uniquely identifies the MBMS Bearer Service.

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.3.4 MBMS Session Identity - Section Description: The MBMS Session Identity identifies the session of a MBMS Bearer Service in E-UTRAN and is used by the UE to recognise repetitions of a session. This IE is transparent to RAN. 9.2.3.4 MBMS Session Identity IE Semantics: Coded same way as the MBMS Session Identity IE as defined in TS 29.061 [8].
9.2.1.3 MBMS E-RAB QoS parameters - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS to be applied to an MBMS E-RAB.
9.2.1.3 QCI IE Semantics: QoS Class Identifier defined in TS 23.246 [6]. Coding is specified in TS 23.203 [7].

9.2.1.3 GBR QoS Information IE Semantics: This IE applies to GBR bearers only and shall be ignored otherwise. 9.2.1.5 GBR QoS Information - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum and guaranteed bit rates of a GBR bearer for downlink.

9.2.1.5 MBMS E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the maximum downlink MBMS E-RAB Bit Rate (i.e. from the EPC to E-UTRAN) for this bearer. 9.2.1.6 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.1.6 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.1.5 MBMS E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the downlink guaranteed MBMS E-RAB Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) from the EPC to the E-UTRAN for this bearer. 9.2.1.6 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.1.6 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.1.8 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance of an MBMS E-RAB compared to other MBMS E-RABs for allocation and retention of the MBMS E-RAB.

9.2.1.8 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE should be understood as the “priority of allocation and retention” (see TS 23.246 [6]). Usage: Value 15 means “no priority”. Values between 1 and 14 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. 1 is the highest and 14 the lowest. Value 0 shall be treated as a logical error if received.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption)
9.2.1.8 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other MBMS E-RABs
9.2.1.8 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the MBMS E-RAB to preemption of other MBMS E-RABs.

9.2.3.5 MBMS Session Duration - Section Description: This IE defines the duration of the MBMS Session. 9.2.3.5 MBMS Session Duration IE Semantics: Coded as the value part of MBMS-Session-Duration AVP as defined in TS 29.061 [8].

9.2.3.6 MBMS Service Area - Section Description: The MBMS Service Area IE consists of a list of one or several MBMS Service Area Identities where each MBMS Service Area Identity is frequency agnostic and can be mapped onto one or more cells. 9.2.3.6 MBMS Service Area IE Semantics: Value part coded per MBMS Service Area AVP as defined in TS 29.061 [8].

9.2.3.8 Minimum Time to MBMS Data Transfer - Section Description: This IE denotes the minimum time occurring between the transmission of the MBMS SESSION START REQUEST message to the MCE and the actual start of the data transfer. The coding of this element is described in TS 48.018 [10]. 9.2.3.8 Minimum Time to MBMS Data Transfer IE Semantics: Coded as the value part of Time to MBMS Data Transfer IE defined in TS 48.018 [10]. 8.6 MBMS Session Update 8.6.2 Successful Operation In MBSFN operation, if the Time of MBMS Data Transfer IE is included in the MBMS SESSION UPDATE REQUEST message, the MCE shall, if supported, take it into account for the synchronization of the corresponding MCCH Update instead of the Minimum Time to MBMS Data Transfer IE. The MCE shall ensure the eNB applies the MCCH update from the last modification period before the time indicated by the Time of MBMS Data Transfer IE. The MCE shall ignore the information contained in the received Minimum Time to MBMS Data Transfer IE.

9.2.2.1 IP Address - Section Description: This information element is an IP address to be used for the user plane transport. 9.2.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Radio Network Layer is not supposed to interpret the address information. It should pass it to the transport layer for interpretation. For details on the Transport Layer Address, see ref. TS 36.445 [9].

9.2.2.1 IP Address - Section Description: This information element is an IP address to be used for the user plane transport. 9.2.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Radio Network Layer is not supposed to interpret the address information. It should pass it to the transport layer for interpretation. For details on the Transport Layer Address, see ref. TS 36.445 [9].

9.2.3.9 Absolute Time of MBMS Data - Section Description: This IE denotes the absolute time of the actual start or stop of the MBMS data transfer. 9.2.3.9 Absolute Time of MBMS Data IE Semantics: Time in seconds relative to 00:00:00 on 1 January 1900 (calculated as continuous time without leap seconds and traceable to a common time reference) where binary encoding of the integer part is in the first 32 bits and binary encoding of the fraction part in the last 32 bits. The fraction part is expressed with a granularity of 1 /2**32 second. 8.6 MBMS Session Update 8.6.2 Successful Operation In MBSFN operation, if the Time of MBMS Data Transfer IE is included in the MBMS SESSION UPDATE REQUEST message, the MCE shall, if supported, take it into account for the synchronization of the corresponding MCCH Update instead of the Minimum Time to MBMS Data Transfer IE. The MCE shall ensure the eNB applies the MCCH update from the last modification period before the time indicated by the Time of MBMS Data Transfer IE. The MCE shall ignore the information contained in the received Minimum Time to MBMS Data Transfer IE.
9.2.1.11 MBMS Cell List - Section Description: This IE consists of a list of cell identities.
9.2.1.11 Cell ID IE Semantics: Global ID of the cell. 9.2.1.12 E-UTRAN CGI - Section Description: This information element is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.1.12 Cell Identity IE Semantics: The 18, 20 or 21 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity correspond to the eNB ID (Global eNB ID IE defined in TS 36.413 [11]).

section_list.name: MBMS SESSION UPDATE RESPONSE
aoa:
This message is sent by the MCE to report the successful outcome of the request from the MBMS SESSION UPDATE REQUEST message.
Direction: MCE ? MME.

CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.3.2 MME MBMS M3AP ID - Section Description: The MME MBMS M3AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M3 interface within the MME.
9.2.3.1 MCE MBMS M3AP ID - Section Description: The MCE MBMS M3AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M3 interface within the MCE.

9.2.1.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the MME or the MCE when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing. For further details on how to use the Criticality Diagnostics IE, (see section 10).

9.2.1.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.1.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.1.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.1.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value 'ignore' shall not be used.
9.2.1.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

section_list.name: Global MCE ID
aoa: This IE is used to globally identify an MCE.

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.1.10 MCE ID Extension IE Semantics: Extension of the Global MCE ID.

section_list.name: MBMS Cell List
aoa: 9.2.1.11 MBMS Cell List Item IE Semantics: This IE consists of a list of cell identities.
9.2.1.11 Cell ID IE Semantics: Global ID of the cell. 9.2.1.12 E-UTRAN CGI - Section Description: This information element is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.1.12 Cell Identity IE Semantics: The 18, 20 or 21 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity correspond to the eNB ID (Global eNB ID IE defined in TS 36.413 [11]).

section_list.name: E-UTRAN CGI
aoa: This information element is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.1.12 Cell Identity IE Semantics: The 18, 20 or 21 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity correspond to the eNB ID (Global eNB ID IE defined in TS 36.413 [11]).

section_list.name: IP Address
aoa: 9.2.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: This information element is an IP address to be used for the user plane transport. The Radio Network Layer is not supposed to interpret the address information. It should pass it to the transport layer for interpretation. For details on the Transport Layer Address, see ref. TS 36.445 [9].

section_list.name: GTP-TEID
aoa: 9.2.2.2 GTP TEID IE Semantics: This information element is the GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier to be used for the user plane transport between eNB and the MBMS-GW. For details and range, see TS 29.281 [12]

section_list.name: MCE MBMS M3AP ID
aoa: 9.2.3.1 MCE MBMS M3AP ID IE Semantics: The MCE MBMS M3AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M3 interface within the MCE.

section_list.name: MME MBMS M3AP ID
aoa: 9.2.3.2 MME MBMS M3AP ID IE Semantics: The MME MBMS M3AP ID uniquely identifies the MBMS Service association over the M3 interface within the MME.

section_list.name: TMGI
aoa: 9.2.3.3 TMGI IE Semantics: The TMGI uniquely identifies the MBMS Bearer Service.

9.2.3.7 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

section_list.name: MBMS Session Identity
aoa: 9.2.3.4 MBMS Session Identity IE Semantics: The MBMS Session Identity identifies the session of a MBMS Bearer Service in E-UTRAN and is used by the UE to recognise repetitions of a session. This IE is transparent to RAN. Coded same way as the MBMS Session Identity IE as defined in TS 29.061 [8].

section_list.name: MBMS Session Duration
aoa: 9.2.3.5 MBMS Session Duration IE Semantics: This IE defines the duration of the MBMS Session. Coded as the value part of MBMS-Session-Duration AVP as defined in TS 29.061 [8].

section_list.name: MBMS Service Area
aoa: 9.2.3.6 MBMS Service Area IE Semantics: The MBMS Service Area IE consists of a list of one or several MBMS Service Area Identities where each MBMS Service Area Identity is frequency agnostic and can be mapped onto one or more cells. Value part coded per MBMS Service Area AVP as defined in TS 29.061 [8].

section_list.name: PLMN Identity
aoa: 9.2.3.7 PLMN identity IE Semantics: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

section_list.name: Minimum Time to MBMS Data Transfer
aoa: Minimum Time to MBMS Data Transfer

9.2.3.8 Minimum Time to MBMS Data Transfer IE Semantics: This IE denotes the minimum time occurring between the transmission of the MBMS SESSION START REQUEST message to the MCE and the actual start of the data transfer. The coding of this element is described in TS 48.018 [10]. Coded as the value part of Time to MBMS Data Transfer IE defined in TS 48.018 [10].

section_list.name: Absolute Time of MBMS Data
aoa: 9.2.3.9 Absolute Time of MBMS Data IE Semantics: This IE denotes the absolute time of the actual start or stop of the MBMS data transfer. Time in seconds relative to 00:00:00 on 1 January 1900 (calculated as continuous time without leap seconds and traceable to a common time reference) where binary encoding of the integer part is in the first 32 bits and binary encoding of the fraction part in the last 32 bits. The fraction part is expressed with a granularity of 1 /2**32 second.

section_list.name: Re-establishment
aoa: 9.2.3.10 Re-establishment IE Semantics: This IE allows identification of the serving MME during some restoration scenarios. Restoration functions are specified in TS 23.007 [14].
